instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: T-Pad jumpy <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi.

No liquid damage, nothing visible.

Fan was running fast, trackpad jumpy, ASD reported sensor failure for Trackpad so I Replaced trackpad.... still jumpy.

ASD now only reports thermal sensor failure on SSD. TH0A TH0B below low limit

threads.title: T-Pad jumpy <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Got a good working battery in there? Is the problem present when on battery power?

threads.title: T-Pad jumpy <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Problem is with battery power, charger power or charger and battery. I have seen shitty chargers cause this kind of thing but this time power source does not seem to change anything

threads.title: T-Pad jumpy <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: No idea then besides a shitty trackpad. I never seen SSD thermal sensors cause this but cannot rule it out.
